entries.text: Leave selected number of items here
Take out selected number of items
Select an item to interact with
Camera reset also resets the camera y-axis.
Set auto lock-on to new target when former target dies.
Automatically target an enemy when attacking close range with no lock.
Set whether the camera automatically avoids walls.
Allows for manual control of aiming of large weapons when locked-on.
Switch depiction of blood on or off, or set to mild.
Switch in-game subtitles on or off.
Configure how in-game HUD is displayed.
Configure cinematic effects used during special attacks.
Edit to match with players using the same password.
Change options for display of player names.
Choose to start the game in online or offline mode
Restrict the visibility of your summon sign in enemy phantom worlds.
Save the game and return to title menu.
Select bonfire to travel to. Ember indicates Host of Embers presence
Level up without spending souls (only one level)
Level up without spending souls (only one level)
Select item to store in box
Select item to take from box
Male Gender has no bearing on ability.
Female Gender has no bearing on ability.
Young Age only affects appearance, and has no bearing on ability.
Mature Age only affects appearance, and has no bearing on ability.
Aged Age only affects appearance, and has no bearing on ability.
Ancient Age only affects appearance, and has no bearing on ability.
The oh-so-plain face of a commoner. Everyone has imperfections, but a commoner without flaws is a rare creature indeed.
The face of a warrior, as if hewn from rock. It's been long whispered in jest northerners are born weathered and old.
The features of a true blue blood. Blue of eye and fair of hair, a little reminder of Astora's former glory.
Intelligent face with fine lines, often ribbed for looking like a prentice.
The face of a cheerless cleric of Carim. "Novice" is used as something of a derogatory term for men of the cloth.
The large eyes and mouth give this face a look of jubilation. From Catarina, known for its zest for life and love of drink.
An uncommon face defined by its narrow eyes and thin lips. Some praise it as the visage of a true dragon.
A uniquely deformed face. Or perhaps merely ugly. Prejudice births malcontents, and malcontents swarm to the Great Swamp.
A lifeless face, almost that of a hollow. Londor is a realm of those hollow and old.
The features of the old gods, as if from legend. They say children born like this are fated to be taken to the Boreal Valley.
The oh-so-plain face of a commoner. Everyone has imperfections, but a commoner without flaws is a rare creature indeed.
The face of a warrior, as if hewn from rock. It's been long whispered in jest northerners are born weathered and old.
The features of a true blue blood. Blue of eye and fair of hair, a little reminder of Astora's former glory.
Intelligent face with fine lines, often ribbed for looking like a prentice.
The face of a cheerless cleric of Carim. "Novice" is used as something of a derogatory term for women of the cloth.
The large eyes and mouth give this face a look of jubilation. From Catarina, known for its zest for life and love of drink.
An uncommon face defined by its narrow eyes and thin lips. Some praise it as the visage of a true dragon.
A uniquely deformed face. Or perhaps merely ugly. Prejudice births malcontents, and malcontents swarm to the Great Swamp.
A lifeless face, almost that of a hollow. Londor is a realm of those hollow and old.
The features of the old gods, as if from legend. They say children born like this are fated to be taken to the Boreal Valley.
Naked and of unknown origin. Either an unimaginable fool in life, or was stripped of possessions upon burial.
An obscure knight of poor renown who collapsed roaming the land.
A common thief and pitiful deserter.
A sentinel of an old abandoned village.
A mercenary and veteran of the battlefield.
A roaming wayfarer, who seeks riches upon the roads.
An assassin who stalks their prey from the shadows.
A wandering samurai, looking to regain lost honour.
Descendant of northern warriors famed for their brawn.
A roaming bandit, looking for their next victim.
A forgotten soldier, left to rot after the war.
An acolyte of Archdragon Peak, who seeks to harness the power of dragons.
A former herald who journeyed to finish a quest undertaken.
Former captain, who collapsed after battle.
A hard-working peasant, who once resided in the undead settlement below Lothric Castle.
An self-proclaimed explorer, who seeks new thrills in the lands of Lothric.
A rough'n'tumble brawler, looking for the next fight.
Once a member of aristocracy, this noble has taken to hunting to fend for themselves.
A loner who left formal academia to pursue further research.
A pyromancer from a remote region who manipulates flame.
A traveling cleric who collapsed from exhaustion.
Once a respected priest, who has fallen on hard times.
Exiled for heretical practices, this sorcerer seeks to learn more of the dark arts.
A heretical pyromancer, who once lived in a swamp. Well-known for their pungent odor.
A skeptical cleric, who turned away from the light.
Once a stalwart paladin, who now wanders lost amoungst the graves.
A foolish jester, looking for good laugh.
A suspicious summoner, who utilises heretical magic to summon entities to assist them.
A worthless specimen, can't even die right.
A skeleton key that will open almost any door. Scroll for additional options.
A bundle of white branches. Scroll for additional options.
The soul of a fallen knight. Scroll for additional options.
A bundle of black firebombs. Scroll for additional options.
A set of old lifegems. Scroll for additional options.
A set of mystical waters. Scroll for additional options.
A restockable throwing knife. Scroll for additional options.
A restockable throwing knife. Scroll for additional options.
A restockable throwing knife. Scroll for additional options.
A restockable throwing knife. Scroll for additional options.
A restockable throwing knife. Scroll for additional options.
Save present settings as a favorite.
Select face similar to present face.
Proportionally large head. Must be full of brains.
